metadata.Title: CVE-2019-14869 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - high.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in all versions of ghostscript 9.x before 9.50, where the `.charkeys` procedure, where it did not properly secure its privileged calls, enabling scripts to bypass `-dSAFER` restrictions. An attacker could abuse this flaw by creating a specially crafted PostScript file that could escalate privileges within the Ghostscript and access files outside of restricted areas or execute commands.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-14869` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ghostscript - 9.26~dfsg+0-0ubuntu0.16.04.12
ghostscript-x - 9.26~dfsg+0-0ubuntu0.16.04.12
libgs9 - 9.26~dfsg+0-0ubuntu0.16.04.12
libgs9-common - 9.26~dfsg+0-0ubuntu0.16.04.12
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ghostscript package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '9.26~dfsg+0-0ubuntu0.16.04.12').
